str2: From the same as trope; a turn, i.e. mode or style; figuratively, deportment or character.

word: free from the love of money
str2: Not loving money, not avaricious. Unavaricious.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To keep off, assist; I suffice; pass: To be satisfied. Apparently a primary verb; properly, to ward off, i.e. to avail.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From ana and hiemi; to let up, i.e. slacken or desert, desist from.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
